content: Ælfric's Grammar, etc.; Rule of St. Benedict, etc.
summary: Made up of two parts: Part 1, fols 3-101: fols 3-100 contains Ã†lfric's Grammar and Glossary , beginning on fol. 3 'gif hÆ¿a Ã¾as boc'. Portions of the text are missing due to loss of leaves (fols 82-87). The glossary begins on fol. 92v. The text was corrected in s. xi/xii, and heavily annotated in several hands towards the end of the twelfth-century in Latin, Anglo-Norman and English. The Latin annotations are mainly marginal; the Anglo-Norman and English are glosses to words added at this time, especially to the glossary (see Zupitza 1880 and Ker 1957, p. 194, for a transcript Hunt 1991, pp. 101-11). Running titles are in Latin. Fols 100v-101v contain a proverb and two maxims in Latin and Old English from the eleventh century (see Zupitza 1880, p. 285 and Dobbie 1942, p. 109); a proverb: 'Ad traem dixit pereant tot buffo magistri. Ã¾a tadda cÆ¿ to Ã¾ar Ã©iÃ¾a ForÆ¿urÃ¾a sÆ¿a fola maistres' written in the second half of the twelfth-century, and some Latin grammatical dialogue and maxims (Ker 1957, p. 194; Doane 2007, pp. 4-6). Part 2, fols 102-51: Ã†thelwold's translation of the Rule of St Benedict in Old English: 'Her beginÃ° seo foresprÃ¦c muneca regules' (fols 102-48), beginning 'Gehyr Ã¾u min bearn geboda Ã¾ines lareowes'. Fols 104v-06r contain a table of 74 chapters which only occurs in this copy of the Old English version. Chapter 7 of the Rule is divided into two parts, both in the table and the text, which are numbered VII and VIII. Annotations to the number of the items are written out: 'an tÆ¿a Ã¾reo feower fif' by a contemporary hand, and 'sex sofana Ã¦hta nigon tin' by a late twelfth-century hand. Each chapter in the text is preceded by its title. In the table of contents and the titles of the chapters the forms are masculine, but in the text are many examples of feminine gender which have been erased and rewritten as masculine (see Schroer 1885-88). According to Ker 1957, the manuscript was 'evidently a version for nuns [that] has been altered for the use of monks' (p. 195). Some words and sentences are glossed occasionally in Latin. The lower parts of fols 115v and 116r, which were originally blank, now contain two recipes for eyesalve; a charm 'Æ¿iÃ¾ utsiht'; three charms in Latin; and later twelfth-century English recipes (see Cockayne 1864-66, iii, p. 292). Fols 148-51v contain the only surviving copy of An Account of King's Edgar's Establishment of Monasteries originally composed in the tenth century, and here beginning 'geard mid Ã¾Ã¦m leoman Ã¾Ã¦s halgan geleafan'. Fols 148-49 contain a number of marginal and interlinear annotations, most of which are marked for insertion in the main text, and most of which come from Ã†lfric's Homily on St. Gregory from the First Series of Catholic Homilies (see, Godden 1979, ix, pp. 71-80, and Ker 1957, p. 195, Swan 2000, pp. 76-78, and Swan 1993, pp. 160-64 for a discussion of the textual sources of the annotations and their relationship to the main text, and pp. 318-21 for a transcription of the annotated section of the main text and the marginal annotations).

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 3r) hic i[n]cipunt excerptiones de arte gra[m]matica anglice

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 3r) [...] gif hƿa þas boc aƿritan ƿylle þæt he hi gerihte ƿel be ðære bysne forðan ðe ic nah geƿeald þeah hi hƿa to ƿoge gebringe þurh lease ƿriteraondhit bið ðonne his pleoh na min. mycel yfel deð se unƿritere gif he nele his ƿoh gerihtan

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 92r) þe ƿæron gedone onealdumdagumondus dyrne ƿæron si þeos boc ðus her geendod

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 92v) In leden spræc synd menigfealde getæl on englisc nis nan þæra geƿunelic buton þrimanum

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 92v) libra on leden is pund on englisc fif ƿenegas gemaciað ænne scyllingondþrittig penega ænne mancus

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 100r) Ƿe ne magon sƿa þeah ealle naman aƿritan. NE FURÐON GEÐENCAN

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 100v) pomum licetab arbore igitur unde reuoluiturtamenprouiditunde nascitur. Se appel næfre þæs feorr ne trend deðhe cyð hƿanon hecom

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 100r) þæs þe ece ne byð

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 100v) ad traeam dixit pereant tot buffo magistri þa taddacƿæðto þar eiþa forƿurþa sƿa fola maistres

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (fol. 101r) prima declinatio quot litteras terminales habet

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body:
Explicit (Latin): (fol. 101v) datiuus et
ablatiuus inbus correptam

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 102r) Her beginð seo forespræc muneca regules. GEHYR ÐU MIN BEARN geboda þines lareoƿesondanhyld þinre heortan eare

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 104v) ondgefean mid him agan moton

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 104v) Her onginnaþ þæra mynstra capitulas. i. an Be muneca cynne

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 106r) xliiii Be þeamþætælc rihtƿisnysse gemen on þissum regule nis geset Her endeiaþ þa captlas

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 106r) De generibusmonachorum>ueluita. Be muneca cynne Syx synt muneca cynerna þara synt þreo þa se lestan

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 110r) ac mid worda andetnesse

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 110r) Hwylc se abbod beon sceal Se abbod þe þæs ƿeorþe is þæt he mynstres ƿealde

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 141v) Ne do þu oþrumþætþu nelle þæt þe sylfum gedon sy

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 141v) BE MYNSTRES sacredumondhyra þenum. lxii Gif hƿylc abbod geþafaþþæt mæssepreost oþþe diacon

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 142r) ac heora goda hlisa gearƿeorþige þa þe hy to þære mæssan þenunge gecuron

notes.head: Note
notes.body: This version of Ch. 63 is unique to this manuscript.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 142r) Be ealles geferes endebyrdenesse. lxiii. Ælc endebyrdnes on mynstre sceal beon gehealden

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 148r) gemundunþætage ƿorþe. ece lif to leanond[...] ƿynuncg mid god eallum þam þe þysum regule filigeaþ. Her geendaþ þæs regules bec federys healicesondþæs eadigan abbodes benedictes. in naman godes ures helendes crystes

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 115v) Ðeos eah sealf mæg wiþ ælces cynnes broc on eagon

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 116r) ondnim þær gode eahsealfe

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 116r) Sy ge menged togædere hunig tear

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 116r) nim þær gode eah sealfe

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 116r) Ðis man sceal singan nigon syþon wiþ utsiht on anhreren bræden æg þry dagas + Ecce dol gold ne dit dudum bethe cunda bræthe cunda

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body:
(fol. 116r) noe uis terre dulge doþ.pater
noster oþ endeond cƿeþ symle æt þam drore huic ðis

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (fol. 116r) + Contra frigoraomnibushoris scribis in cartsetcum licio ligas ad collum egroti hora deficiente

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: Explicit (Latin): (fol. 116r) + Eugenius stephanusprotaciussambucius dionasius chesiliusetquiriacus ista nomina scribe etsuperse portatquipatitur

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (fol. 116r) + contra febres in nominescanteet indiuidue.trinitatis in effeso ciuitate chelde ibi requiescunt. vii.sanctidormientes

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: Explicit (Latin): (fol. 116r) et de omni populo inimici. Amen.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 148r) [...] middangears mid þæm leoman þæs halgan geleafan mildheortlice ƿearð gefylled

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 151v) Þæt la ne geƿeorþe þæt minra æftergengenna ænig þa yrmþe geearnige [...]

objectDesc.extent:
c. 220 mm x 145 mm (dimensions of all - size of leaves).
c. 187 mm x c. 103 mm (dimensions of Part 1: fols 3-101, size varies, but all slightly larger than part 2 - size of written space).
c. 175 mm x c. 95 mm (dimensions of Part 2: fols 102-51 - size of written space)
objectDesc.foliation: Fols vi + 149 + v, foliated (i-iv), 1-151, (152-56). Fols (i-iv), 1, 2, (152-6) are post-medieval parchment and paper. An old foliation of perhaps s. xii occurs at the foot of the rectos of fols 3-36, 41, 51, 61, 62, 71, 81, 89 as follows: ii-xxxxv, xl, l, lx, l, x, xx, xxx. They are written in a similar hand to Royal 15. B. xxii, but appear in the right corner of the rectos.
objectDesc.collation: Quires: Collation of fols 3-151: 18 wants 1 before fol. 3, 2-108, 118 wants 1 before fols 82 and 8 after fols 87, 128, 136 wants 6, probably blank, +1 leaf after 4 (fol. 100), 148, 1512 wants 3-5 after fol. 111, 1610, 1712, 186, 19 five (fols 147-51). A leaf is missing after fol. 81 and after fol. 87. Ker 1957 (p. 196) notes that 'fols 104-07 are two bifolia formed by folding in half two leaves of a larger manuscript which was ruled but not written on: the old ruling runs vertically down the page'.
objectDesc.layoutDescription: Written in 28 long lines (27 in Quire 16), frame in dry point and double bounding lines on both side of the frame. External pricking to guide the ruling of the lines.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 3-101. A round and regular insular script with occasional Caroline features, which does not distinguish between Caroline and insular letter forms. This hand also shares some similarities with

characters.note: a is Caroline in the combination æ.
Long s is regular initially and medially but not finally.
The cross-bar of ð is usually nearly horizontal and sometimes inclines slightly downwards from left to right. Tall tapered ascender curving to the left
descenders: tapered descenders with a serif which turns to the left, except p, which ends with a flat foot.
The common mark of abbreviation is cup-shaped.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 102-51 (except lower parts of 115v and 116v). A regular, angular hand mixing insular and Caroline features.

characters.note: descenders: tapered descenders with sharp, short serifs to the left.
ascenders: flat, upright ascenders which thick strokes.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 115v lower half and 116r lower half. A similar hand to the main hand of the

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fol. 116r top and right-hand margin. Another hand including English and Latin additions.

decoration: Fols 3-101, red initials, titles in red rustic capitals, some capitals tinted in red.
binding: Rebound in nineteenth-century; nail-mark from a former binding on fols 149-51.

history.provenance: Part 1 was probably written in the same scriptorim as Hatton 115 (Ker 1957, p. 196). Parts 1 and 2 have probably been together since the twelfth-century: the annotations on fols 92v and 103 are by the same hand (see also Hunt 1991, p. 111). The contents of the manuscript suggest a south-east origin; perhaps Rochester or Christ Church, Canterbury (Treharne 1998, pp. 232-33). The manuscript probably travelled 'to Worcester in the twelfth-century, and was reorganised there' (Swan 2007, p. 39).
history.acquisition: Acquired by the British Museum along with the rest of the Cotton collection .

admin: Manuscript described by Orietta Da Rold and Mary Swan with the assistance of Hollie Morgan and Johanna Green (2010; 2013).
